result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dustin Cruz White

records.addlTxt:
CASES: 21CF212, 21CF248, 21CF404, 21CF406, 21CF424, 22CF25. 3:08 PM Defendant Dustin Cruz White in court. Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Dustin Cruz White. Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. CT questions def. ADA has filed amended information in 21CF404 and 21CF248. Felony warnings given. 
In 21CF248 amended count 3- def- G plea. 
In 21CF404 amended count 1 - def- G plea. Count 3- def- G plea. CT accepts pleas, adj G on those counts. 
Remaining counts in 404 and 248 are RI&D on state's motion. As are 21CF212, 21CF406, 21CF424, 22CF25 RI&D on state's motion. Def requests to waive PSI. Counsel stipulates to waiver. CT finds waiver of PSI is made FK&V. LKW makes statement. Sentencing arguments. Counsel stipulates to 21CF404- 73 days credit. 21CF248- 1 day credit. 

SENTENCE
21CF404: W/held sent 3 years probation on both counts 1 and 3, concurrent. Probation conditions on all: AODA and comply. 180 days banked jail. Not subject to good time. If def objects to any banked jail, must file written request for hearing within 5 days. $290.60 fine/costs, $250 DNA surcharge and sample on each count. 73 days credit. May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. 

21CF248 count 3: W/held sent up to 2 years probation. Domestic abuse evaluation and comply. $265.60 fine/costs, $200 DNA surcharge and sample. 60 dtp or set up PP with COCC. 1 day credit. Eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation and sentence and all fine/costs are paid, no new convictions. Must report to probation today. PCR. 3:42 pm adj.

CASES: 21CF212, 21CF248, 21CF404, 21CF406, 21CF424, 22CF25. 04:01 PM Defendant Dustin Cruz White in court with attorney Dan Firkus. Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster appeared by video means for the State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. Resolved. Plea/sent set. Bond cont. 4:05 pm adj.
Status conference on April 4, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
No controlled substances without a prescription.   Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.  Not to be in presents of persons actively using drugs.

Benjamin James Webster appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Defendant Dustin Cruz White.  Dustin Cruz White appeared by video means from the PCJ.  BJM-clerk 2:24 pm State req sign bond.  CT sets bond.  WTL.  2:27 pm adj.  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
